metadata.titel_preek: The Feast of the Presentation of our Lord (Candlemas)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His salvation (the Messiah) to faithful watchers through the Holy Spirit, enabling them to recognize and receive Him despite the Messiah's humble appearance.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has called them for this purpose
He is at work, not only in the infant Jesus, but in the hearts and minds of those who see him
It had been revealed to [Simeon] by the Holy Spirit
mine eyes have seen thy salvation
a light for revelation to the Gentiles
prepared in the presence of all peoples
to be the glory of thy people Israel
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver (the one waiting to meet Christ).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Law and Prophets
tekstueel_bewijs: enabled by God’s Spirit to recognize
the Holy Spirit is directing them
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (initiator) and Helper (enabler).

tegenstander.identificatie: Human expectation / Sin and Death / The Powers of Darkness
tekstueel_bewijs: most people’s idea of the Messiah was thoroughly predictable
final assault by the powers of darkness
crucial battles against sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'powers of darkness' and the ontological reality of death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having seen Christ, responds by praising God and telling others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Simeon/Anna/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The response (Secondary) is a direct consequence of the revelation (Primary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → God/Christ ← Powers of Darkness

voorbeelden_god_subject: He is at work... in the hearts and minds
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Simeon knows by the power of the Spirit
You too are called to meet him

voorbeelden: battles... that we all must fight
looking for the consolation of Israel
enabled to discern the action of God
they do not see with ordinary human sight
His Body and Blood are given to sustain you

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that human recognition of God is an 'enabled' capacity (Pouvoir) granted by the Spirit, not a natural skill.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'diminishments' of age (~S1) to the 'light' of revelation (S1), acknowledging the 'shadow of the cross' (S2) as the means to 'peace' (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ enters the 'final assault' of S2 to bring the hearer to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and the cross are central, not bypassed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly denies human capacity as the source of faith, attributing the 'meeting' to God's enabling action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Simeon and Anna are models for us.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I did not say, 'They are able to discern …' but 'They are enabled.'
the final assault by the powers of darkness

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Simeon and Anna are models of 'waiting,' but the preacher immediately qualifies this by stating their waiting was empowered by the Spirit.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God preserves a remnant (Simeon/Anna) to witness His arrival.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and expectancy; the burden of 'seeing' is shifted to God's 'enabling'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic revelation; faith is a gift.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical Simeon to the contemporary hearer is seamless through the work of the Spirit.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'heroic exploits' of the veterans and the 'silent heroism' of waiting.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has hailed the conqueror... the final assault by the powers of darkness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Savoir' and 'Pouvoir' to recognize Christ.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'battle' and a 'power of darkness', not just a mistake.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. Even when human action is mentioned, it is framed as 'enabled' action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's enabling).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'meeting' in the Eucharist even more strongly to the 'enabling' of the Spirit.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God reveals) correctly precedes Ethics (signing on in service).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profoundly grace-oriented sermon that avoids the trap of turning Simeon into a moral hero by emphasizing the Holy Spirit as the true Subject of the 'recognition'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the Rembrandt illustration; Greimas shows that the painting functions as a 'Helper' for the hearer's 'Savoir-faire'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Nunc Dimittis; semiotics explains why the 'Nunc Dimittis' is a transfer of Object from God to Simeon.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'veterans' story is not just an anecdote but a modal parallel to the 'watch' of the actants.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Subject-Check' by Rutledge.
